intro: Chamaesyce rattanii, commonly known as the rattan leaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, green, succulent-like leaves that are often clustered at the base. It produces inconspicuous flowers that are typically surrounded by bracts, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid or semi-arid environments.
